Posts.Content: Hello Baki, It sounds like you have done everything you can to keep well..Despite all your efforts there is cancer progression which you  cannot control  I think as women we are very good at blaming ourselves for our predicament e.g if I hadn't been so stressed at work, been overweight etc...because we need to have a reason for having this disease, to almost make sense of it.The medical team seem to be working hard through appeals and that is a good thing, not all health trusts would do this..but you are worth it.It sounds like there is hope.Everything you are feeling,hopeless and frightened seems  normal and part of the adjustment process to the fact that the cancer is not curative.I work in a hospital and I know patients have accessed the psychologist and macmillan practitioners and found it really helped. I am stage 3,but I have written my will and made practical plans so I could feel  in control. It was difficult because I thought by planning/thinking about my death I might make it happen and family thought I was been defeatist. However, in regard to my children I wanted them to have security if the worst should happen. The Vita online mag has some good bloggers on it who have secondary breast cancer ,maybe you should take a look. Fingers well and truly crossed for the appeals and sending you positive vibes!

Posts.Title: Feel there is no hope

Posts.Content: Hello, I was in the same position as you.My bloods were off .However, I was being investigated for a bowel prolem and I thought it was related to this. Basically, I was told that I was the fittest person who had entered the docs office.The lump I ignored thinking it was related to an injury...I didnt fit the profile for bc so I ignored it. This went on for months and then I became too embarrassed  to seek help.I work in health and had no excuses.I felt guilty for a very long time, my mum and sis we're angry but my hubby was understanding .I have finally let this guilt go, I cannot change the past and I have put my energy into making myself as fit as possible to reduce the risk of reoccurrance. Guilt is such a negative  and destructive  force ...at some point you will let it go.Take care bx
